snippet: Before Twitter moved in, San Francisco’s Mid-Market area was run down and not very safe. Now that’s changed, thanks to tax breaks and a need for office space in the city.
abstract: Middle stretch of Market Street in San Francisco, vacant and blighted strip that was not very safe, is being transformed after Twitter moved its headquarters here; social media company had been attracted to neighborhood because of tax breaks and need for office space in the city; now 15 other companies, emboldened by Twitter's move, are moving there as well.
lead_paragraph: Before Twitter moved in, San Francisco’s Mid-Market area was run down and not very safe. Now that’s changed, thanks to tax breaks and a need for office space in the city.

headline.main: Twitter Helps Revive a Seedy San Francisco Neighborhood
headline.print_headline: Twitter’s New Home Is Helping Revive A Seedy San Francisco Neighborhood
